p: The increase of melanin in the epidermis can cause many disorders such as lentigo and inflammatory pigmentations [ 71]. Hyperpigmentation is one of the most frequent skin problems due to the influence of hormones; women tend to get hyperpigmentation more frequently than men [ 72]. The use of depigmenting, whitening products is very common for Caucasian women and there are many studies forward towards this area. A significant number of plant extracts are potent inhibitors of melanin formation with an action comparable to chemical compounds (e.g., hydroquinone) having as an advantage the fact that they are not associated with the cytotoxicity of melanocytes [ 73]. The group of Maack et al., has evaluated the tyrosinase inhibitory capacity of ethanolic black poplar extract. Results have shown that the absolute extract inhibit in vitro the tyrosinase activity in cultured B16F10 murine melanoma cell lines, reducing melanogenesis [ 74].
